item.title: Indian Equity Markets See Mixed Trading as IT Sector Leads Gains Amidst Broad-Based Declines
item.description: Indian equity benchmarks closed marginally lower on 7 January 2026, with the Nifty slipping 0.14% to 26,140.75 and the Sensex retreating 0.12% to 84,961.14. Despite the subdued overall market tone, sectoral divergences were evident as the BSE IT index surged 1.97%, emerging as the top sectoral gainer, while the S&P BSE Utilities index declined 0.80%, marking the steepest sectoral fall. Market breadth remained balanced with an almost equal number of advances and declines across the BSE 500 universe, reflecting cautious investor sentiment ahead of key corporate earnings. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: SMT Engineering Leads Exceptional Half-Year Returns with 825% Surge
item.description: SMT Engineering, a micro-cap player in the Trading & Distributors sector, has delivered a staggering 825.05% return over the past six months, outpacing all other top performers and significantly outperforming benchmark indices. This extraordinary rally has been driven by a combination of bullish technical signals, strong financials, and sector-specific catalysts, positioning the stock as a standout performer in a challenging market environment. Time: 2 hours ago
